original: sgra bzhin pa la zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra bzhin pa la zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to stop clinging to the literal meaning,

analyzed: bdag gis cung zad gsal bar btu bar bya //
translated: I will slightly clarify and extract them.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis nga'i gsung rab rnams 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng gzhi dang ldan par bsdus shig @2a * //🔽ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis nga'i gsung rab rnams 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng gzhi dang ldan par bsdus shig @2a * // ces gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, the perfect, complete Buddha said, “Compile my scriptures with the nidāna, ‘Thus I have heard at one time,’ and so on.”

original: de'i phyir yang dag par sdud po byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos 'dir gleng gzhi nye bar dgod /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par sdud po byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos 'dir gleng gzhi nye bar dgod /
translated: Therefore, the compiler Bodhisattva Vajra garbha here sets forth the nidāna.🔽“ Thus I have heard at one time” and so on is set forth first.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bhya ga la bzhugs te zhes bya ba dang por bkod pa di yang dang por phun sum tshogs pa rjod par byed
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bhya ga la bzhugs te zhes bya ba dang por bkod pa di yang dang por phun sum tshogs pa rjod par byed
translated: “ The Bhagavān dwelt in the bhaga of the vajra queen of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas” is also stated first to express the first perfection.

original: pa thun mong gi lugs kyis bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: pa thun mong gi lugs kyis bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation according to the common system.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni dris ba'i tshig gi lan te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni dris ba'i tshig gi lan te /
translated: Here, this is called the answer to the question.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar thos pa ltar smros shig ces dris pa dang / des bdag gis 'chad par byed pa 'di skad bcom ldan 'das las thos so zhes lan btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar thos pa ltar smros shig ces dris pa dang / des bdag gis 'chad par byed pa 'di skad bcom ldan 'das las thos so zhes lan btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas asked the bodhisattva Vajra garbha, “Speak as you have heard it from the Bhagavat.” He replied, “What I will explain is thus: I have heard it from the Bhagavat.”

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni 'di skad thos pa de nyid mngon du thos kyi gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni 'di skad thos pa de nyid mngon du thos kyi gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “ I” indicates that he directly heard that very “thus have I heard,” not from one who has heard it from another.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas yul du byas pa'o //
translated: “ Heard” means that it was made an object by the ear consciousness.

original: 'dis na mngon du byas par khas mi len te /
analyzed: 'dis na mngon du byas par khas mi len te /
translated: This does not accept that it was made manifest.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa de kho na'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa de kho na'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the domain of the omniscient one alone.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus yang dang yang du 'di mnyan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus yang dang yang du 'di mnyan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: At one time means that this was not heard at different times,

original: dus gzhan du ni gzhan thos @2b la ;
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni gzhan thos @2b la ;
translated: but at another time, something else was heard.

original: dus gcig na ni 'di thos zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na ni 'di thos zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: But at one time means that this was heard.

original: de bas na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di rnams rim pa bzhin du gya tshom du mi 'jug pa dang / legs par gzung ba dang / ston pa'i mngon sum gyi slob ma yin pa dang / thos pa mang po'i yon tan rnam pa bzhis sdud pa po phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di rnams rim pa bzhin du gya tshom du mi 'jug pa dang / legs par gzung ba dang / ston pa'i mngon sum gyi slob ma yin pa dang / thos pa mang po'i yon tan rnam pa bzhis sdud pa po phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, these words of the preface, Thus have I heard at one time, show the perfection of the compiler through four qualities: not engaging in confusion, proper retention, being a direct disciple of the Teacher, and the quality of being learned.

original: dus phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa dus gcig na zhes smos pa nyid de //
analyzed: dus phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa dus gcig na zhes smos pa nyid de //
translated: The perfection of time is shown by the statement at one time.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku'i lo brgyad cur 'dzam bu'i gling du bzhugs pa de srid la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku'i lo brgyad cur 'dzam bu'i gling du bzhugs pa de srid la /
translated: Thus, for as long as the Bhagavān's nirmāṇakāya remained in Jambudvīpa for eighty years,

original: rgyud rin po che 'di ni yang nas yang du ma gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rgyud rin po che 'di ni yang nas yang du ma gsungs kyi /
translated: this precious tantra was not taught again and again,

original: dus gcig na lan cig gsungs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na lan cig gsungs pa kho na ste /
translated: but was taught only once at one time.

original: de bas na 'di'i dus na dus gzhan pas khyad par 'phags pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i dus na dus gzhan pas khyad par 'phags pa de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, at this time, it is the very best of all times.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni rnyed dka' ba'i phyir bstan pa'i bdag nyid phun sum tshogs par yang legs par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni rnyed dka' ba'i phyir bstan pa'i bdag nyid phun sum tshogs par yang legs par brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is well-said that this is the perfection of the nature of the teaching because it is difficult to obtain.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen rnams //
analyzed: 'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen rnams //
translated: The Omniscient Ones in the world

original: au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
translated: are like the udumbara flower.🔽They appear only once in a long time,

original: brgya lam na ni lan 'ga' zhig /'byung 'gyur na yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brgya lam na ni lan 'ga' zhig /'byung 'gyur na yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and even then, not at all.

original: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba //
translated: The way of Mantra practice

original: de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste / zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste / zhes gsungs so //
translated: is even more rare than that.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bsnyad par bcom ldan 'das zhes smos te ;
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bsnyad par bcom ldan 'das zhes smos te ;
translated: The perfection of the teacher is stated with “the Blessed One.”

original: bdud bzhi'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das te des so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das te des so //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has destroyed the four demons, according to the method of the etymological definition.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i don gyis shes rab ni bcom pa'i sgras bstan la de dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i don gyis shes rab ni bcom pa'i sgras bstan la de dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Or else, wisdom is indicated by the term “conqueror” because it conquers the afflictions.

original: yang na 'jigs pa bral bas ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: yang na 'jigs pa bral bas ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Or else, he is the Bhagavān because he is free from fear.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba las /
translated: As the noble Akṣayamatisūtra teaches,

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos rnams ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos rnams ni //
translated: “The Dharma is like space,

original: lus can dag la rab ston kyang //
analyzed: lus can dag la rab ston kyang //
translated: and he teaches it to embodied beings.

original: 'di la 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas //
analyzed: 'di la 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas //
translated: Since he has no fear,

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad //🔽ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽yang na yon tan mtha' yas pa ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o // yang na yon tan mtha' yas pa ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: he is therefore called the Bhagavān.”

original: bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Or else, he is the Bhagavān because he possesses infinite virtues.

original: de nyid 'di nyid las yon tan drug ces bshad pa ni /🔽dbang sogs yon tan mtha' dag go //
analyzed: de nyid 'di nyid las yon tan drug ces bshad pa ni / dbang sogs yon tan mtha' dag go //
translated: As the same text says,

original: zhes 'chad par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par mdzad do //
translated: “The Bhagavān is the one who possesses all virtues, such as the powers.”

original: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa bral bas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa bral bas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Or else, he is the Bhagavān because he is free from existence and from the transcendence of existence.

original: rtag pa mi gnas @3a * //
analyzed: rtag pa mi gnas @3a * //
translated: He is the one who is permanent and does not abide in the extremes.

original: pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of all phenomena is nirvana.

original: 'di dag ni rnam grangs kyi rab tu sbyor bas yin gyi the tshom gyi sbyor bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam grangs kyi rab tu sbyor bas yin gyi the tshom gyi sbyor bas ni ma yin no //
translated: These are the applications of synonyms, not the applications of doubt.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs par brjod pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang sku dang gsung dan thugs dang / rdo rje btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs par brjod pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang sku dang gsung dan thugs dang / rdo rje btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The statement of the perfection of retinue is “all tathagatas, body, speech, mind, and vajra queens.”

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Thus, the supramundane retinue is all tathagatas such as Vairochana, and the three types of bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha,

original: sku dang gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bdag med rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa rdo rje btsun mo rnams dang thams gcig tu thos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bdag med rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa rdo rje btsun mo rnams dang thams gcig tu thos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the vajra bodhisattvas of body, speech, and mind, and the vajra queens such as Nairatmya. “ All” means all together.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i 'khor rnams dang yang sta /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i 'khor rnams dang yang sta /
translated: Likewise, it is also with the mundane retinue.

original: de ltar yang rgyud 'di nyid kyi brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur las rjes su yi rang brjod pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyud 'di nyid kyi brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur las rjes su yi rang brjod pa las /
translated: Thus, in the thirty-second chapter of this very tantra, the Vajra-Tent of the Dakinis, it says, in the expression of rejoicing:

original: lha la sogs pa'i 'khor smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i 'khor smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it mentions the retinue of gods and so forth.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir dang por ma byas she na /
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir dang por ma byas she na /
translated: If it is asked why it is not done first,

original: 'di'i zlas grub pa'i phyir mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'di'i zlas grub pa'i phyir mi dgos te /
translated: it is not necessary because it is implied by this.

original: nges par 'du bar zla'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: nges par 'du bar zla'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It is understood only by the door of implication.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the perfect place,

original: bha ga zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bha ga zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says “bhaga.”

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bems po ma yin pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bems po ma yin pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa /
translated: Because it is the nature of pristine consciousness, it is a palace that is not inanimate, with four corners and four doors,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gyis spras pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gyis spras pa /
translated: adorned with special supramundane conditions,

original: tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyu las byung ba de ni bha ga ste de na'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyu las byung ba de ni bha ga ste de na'o //
translated: and it arises from the cause of immeasurable merit. That is bhaga, and there is the bhaga.

original: 'di nyid gang na zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid gang na zhe na /
translated: If it is asked where is this,🔽it is in the bhaga of the mother.

original: gang dag skal pa dang ldan pa de dag la ni rgyal po'i khab la sogs pa tha ma la pa'i gnas 'di dag nyid de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag skal pa dang ldan pa de dag la ni rgyal po'i khab la sogs pa tha ma la pa'i gnas 'di dag nyid de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: For those who are fortunate, these places such as Rajagrha appear in that way.

original: kha cig na re 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i lam ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas su bshad do zhes zer la /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i lam ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas su bshad do zhes zer la /
translated: Some say that the path with passion is explained as the place of the Paranirmitavasavartins.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ri rab ri'i rtse mo khang bu brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang ni bha ga ste der zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ri rab ri'i rtse mo khang bu brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang ni bha ga ste der zhes so //
translated: Therefore, the palace of the summit of Mount Meru is the bhaga, and it is said, “there.”

original: kha cig na re longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yis 'di gsungs la /
analyzed: kha cig na re longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yis 'di gsungs la /
translated: Some say that the Enjoyment Body taught this.

original: de yang gzugs kyi rtse mo'i 'og min gnas pas /🔽gzhi tshad med pa thams cad kun du son pa /
analyzed: de yang gzugs kyi rtse mo'i 'og min gnas pas / gzhi tshad med pa thams cad kun du son pa /
translated: Moreover, since the Akanistha of the peak of existence is below,🔽the bhaga is the realm of Ghanavyuha, which is the place of the limitless basis, which is everywhere,

original: mtha' de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul du gyur pa stug po bkod pa'i zhing khams kho na bha ga ste der zhes so //
analyzed: mtha' de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul du gyur pa stug po bkod pa'i zhing khams kho na bha ga ste der zhes so //
translated: and which is the domain of the Tathagata.

original: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gdul bya @3b rnams kyi yul dang mthun par spyod lam bzhi dang ldan par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gdul bya @3b rnams kyi yul dang mthun par spyod lam bzhi dang ldan par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Abiding” means abiding in the four modes of conduct in accordance with the domain of those to be tamed.

original: de ltar na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa nas bzhugs te zhes pa'i bar gyis rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa drug legs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa nas bzhugs te zhes pa'i bar gyis rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa drug legs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, from “Thus have I heard” up to “was dwelling” has well explained the six perfections of this king of tantras.

original: de ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi sdud pa po phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'i sgo nas bshad de /
analyzed: de ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi sdud pa po phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'i sgo nas bshad de /
translated: That is explained by way of the perfection of the compiler, the introduction of the tantra.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, all tathāgatas are Vairocana and so forth.

original: de rnams sku dang gsung dang thugs ni mi phyed pa'i rdo rje sta /
analyzed: de rnams sku dang gsung dang thugs ni mi phyed pa'i rdo rje sta /
translated: Their body, speech, and mind are the indivisible vajra.

original: de rnams nyid 'di ltar gdul bya'i dbang gis btsun mor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid 'di ltar gdul bya'i dbang gis btsun mor gyur pa'o //
translated: They themselves, in this way, are the queens in accordance with the power of the disciples.

original: de rnams kyi bha ga ni bla ma'i yang bla ma'i chos bstan pa dang mthun pa'i chos khang pa brtsegs pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga ni bla ma'i yang bla ma'i chos bstan pa dang mthun pa'i chos khang pa brtsegs pa ste de la'o //

translated: Like the supreme joy of a young woman,

original: bstan du med pa'i bde ba 'byung //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: bstan du med pa'i bde ba 'byung // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: the inexpressible bliss arises.

original: rang gis nyams su myong ba ji lta ba slob ma la brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong ba ji lta ba slob ma la brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the experience just as it is is not to be expressed to the disciple.

original: gzhan @8b yang nyams su myong ba'i don brjod na //
analyzed: gzhan @8b yang nyams su myong ba'i don brjod na //
translated: Moreover, if the meaning of the experience is expressed,

original: ci dbang po gnyis las byung ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba brjod pa'am /
analyzed: ci dbang po gnyis las byung ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba brjod pa'am /
translated: is the experience of the bliss arising from the two organs expressed,

original: yang na spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes rtogs pa brjod /
analyzed: yang na spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes rtogs pa brjod /
translated: or is the realization of the wisdom free from conceptual elaboration expressed?

original: dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first is not so,

original: de ni bla ma la rag mi las shing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bla ma la rag mi las shing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not depend on the guru and arises for all who are free from attachment.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni de thob pa la rag mi las shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa dang mi ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni de thob pa la rag mi las shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa dang mi ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were the second case, then it would not depend on obtaining it, and it would follow that even some who do not possess the aspects of the perfections would accomplish it.

original: gang gsungs pa'i /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa'i /
translated: As for what is said:

original: yang dag dbang ni bskur ba la //
analyzed: yang dag dbang ni bskur ba la //
translated: In the conferral of the true empowerment,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: and so forth, that is not a refutation,

original: rig pa'i dbang gi dgongs pa dang yul thams cad ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang gi dgongs pa dang yul thams cad ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intention of the empowerment of knowledge and all objects are not apprehended.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: However, this is not reasonable,

original: rig pa'i dbang ni sku rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang ni sku rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: because the empowerment of knowledge is the pure body,

original: gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dag pa ni gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis rig pa'i dbang bskur ba de ni sku 'ba' zhig rnam par dag pa yin gyi thugs dang gsung dag pa ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dag pa ni gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis rig pa'i dbang bskur ba de ni sku 'ba' zhig rnam par dag pa yin gyi thugs dang gsung dag pa ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: and the purities of the secret and wisdom-knowledge are the pure speech and mind. Therefore, for whom the empowerment of knowledge is conferred, that is only the pure body, but the mind and speech are not pure.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di ni mchog tu 'khrul pa'i gnas gang zag gi bsam pa la brten pa tsam yin gyi nges par gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di ni mchog tu 'khrul pa'i gnas gang zag gi bsam pa la brten pa tsam yin gyi nges par gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, this is a case of supreme error, based merely on the ideas of individuals, and not on certainty.

original: de ltar min na rig pa'i dbang yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar min na rig pa'i dbang yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then the mastery of knowledge would be completely lost.

original: 'di ltar chu dang cod pan dang rdo rje dang dril bu dang / ming gis rim pa bzhin du me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnams 'grub par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu dang cod pan dang rdo rje dang dril bu dang / ming gis rim pa bzhin du me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnams 'grub par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that the water, crown, vajra, bell, and name initiations respectively establish the mirror-like, the equality, the individual-realization, the performance, and the pure-land of phenomena wisdoms.

original: gang yang ye shes ldan rnam par dag pa'i mthar gyur kyang gsung dang thugs rnam par ma dag pa zhig na su zhig bstan pa 'di la brtson par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang ye shes ldan rnam par dag pa'i mthar gyur kyang gsung dang thugs rnam par ma dag pa zhig na su zhig bstan pa 'di la brtson par 'gyur /
translated: And, if someone were to have the pure wisdom initiation, but not the pure speech and mind initiations, who would strive in this teaching?

original: de bas na gang gis rig pa'i dbang bzung ba de ni dbang rnam pa gsum la dbang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang gis rig pa'i dbang bzung ba de ni dbang rnam pa gsum la dbang ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, one who has taken the knowledge initiation is only one who has the three initiations.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni bstan par mi 'gyur te don med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni bstan par mi 'gyur te don med do zhe na /
translated: Thus, these are not taught, because they are useless.

original: thams cad du ni dgag par mi spyor ro //
analyzed: thams cad du ni dgag par mi spyor ro //
translated: But the negation is not applied everywhere.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig tu mu tig gi do shal dag pa bas chang ba stong ba bstan pa nyid ches thabs su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig tu mu tig gi do shal dag pa bas chang ba stong ba bstan pa nyid ches thabs su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in some cases, a thousand empty vessels are taught to be more useful than a pure pearl necklace.

original: le'u lnga pa'i rdo rje'i tshig btu ba'o /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i rdo rje'i tshig btu ba'o /
translated: The selection of the vajra verses of the fifth chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni le'u drug pa'i rdo rje'i tshig btu ba la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni le'u drug pa'i rdo rje'i tshig btu ba la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Now, we will begin the selection of the vajra verses of the sixth chapter.

original: shing gcig drung ngam dur khrod du //
analyzed: shing gcig drung ngam dur khrod du //
translated: At the foot of a tree or in a charnel ground,

original: bsgom pa dag ni dge bar gsungs //
analyzed: bsgom pa dag ni dge bar gsungs //
translated: meditation is said to be virtuous.

original: mtshan mo mo'i khyim de bzhin //
analyzed: mtshan mo mo'i khyim de bzhin //
translated: At night, in a woman's house,

original: yang na dben dang bas @9a * //
analyzed: yang na dben dang bas @9a * //
translated: or in a secluded place,

original: mthar ni // cung zad drod ni thob byas la //
analyzed: mthar ni // cung zad drod ni thob byas la //
translated: having attained a little warmth,

original: gang zhig 'dod pas spyad pa bya //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pas spyad pa bya //
translated: one should engage in the practice of desire.

original: zhes bya ba la shing gcig ces bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yal ga du ma dang ldan pa'i lus nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la shing gcig ces bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yal ga du ma dang ldan pa'i lus nyid do //
translated: Here, a tree refers to the body itself, which has many branches such as arms.

original: dur khrod ces bya ba ni rang gi lus nyid de /
analyzed: dur khrod ces bya ba ni rang gi lus nyid de /
translated: A charnel ground refers to one's own body.

original: de ltar yang 'di nyid las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di nyid las /
translated: Thus, in this very [tantra] it is said:

original: dbugs dang rab tu ldan pa la //🔽dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: dbugs dang rab tu ldan pa la // dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
translated: In union with the breath,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: it is called the charnel ground.

original: khams bdun pa ni ma mo ste de rnams 'dus pa ni ma mo'i khyim mo //
analyzed: khams bdun pa ni ma mo ste de rnams 'dus pa ni ma mo'i khyim mo //
translated: The seven constituents are the mothers, and their assembly is the house of the mothers.

original: de bas na de yang rang gi lus nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de yang rang gi lus nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that [house] is also one's own body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gnyid log pa'i dus ni mtshan mo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gnyid log pa'i dus ni mtshan mo'o //
translated: The time of falling asleep due to passion and so forth is night.

original: dben pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi rgyu ba'o //
translated: Solitude is the non-movement of conceptual thoughts.

original: bas mtha' zhes bya ba ni padma'i lte bar ro //
analyzed: bas mtha' zhes bya ba ni padma'i lte bar ro //
translated: The edge is the center of the lotus.

original: bsgom pa dag ni dge bar gsungs //
analyzed: bsgom pa dag ni dge bar gsungs //
translated: Meditation is said to be virtuous.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom par bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom par bsngags pa'o //
translated: This praises the cultivation of the perfection stage through union with a wisdom consort who resembles one's own body.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: rang gi lus tha ma la pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa ngan pa dang bral bas rig ma'i padma'i lte bar rdo rje bzhag ste man ngag ji lta bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus tha ma la pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa ngan pa dang bral bas rig ma'i padma'i lte bar rdo rje bzhag ste man ngag ji lta bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One who is free from the desire for one's own body, etc. , and free from bad thoughts, should place the vajra in the lotus of the knowledge woman and meditate according to the esoteric instructions.

original: gang zhig rnal 'byor ngal bar byas pas nus pa khyad par can rnyed pas nye bar 'tshe bas mi gnod pa'i mthu de ni drod ces brjod la /
analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor ngal bar byas pas nus pa khyad par can rnyed pas nye bar 'tshe bas mi gnod pa'i mthu de ni drod ces brjod la /
translated: One who, by the fatigue of yoga, has obtained a special ability, and has the power not to be harmed by harm, that is called heat.

original: de yang yongs su rdzogs par ma yin pas na cung zad thob ces byas la zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang yongs su rdzogs par ma yin pas na cung zad thob ces byas la zhes smos so //
translated: And since that is not fully complete, it is said having obtained a little.

original: de ltar drod thob pa de dag kyang nges par ni spyod pa byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar drod thob pa de dag kyang nges par ni spyod pa byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who have obtained heat like that are not necessarily practitioners of the conduct,

original: rang gi 'dod pa la rag las pas na gang zhig 'dod pas spyad pa bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa la rag las pas na gang zhig 'dod pas spyad pa bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: but since it depends on one's desire, it is said one who wishes to practice the conduct.

original: 'di dag ni sgra ji bzhin bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sgra ji bzhin bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: These are easy to understand as they are explained literally.

original: rtag tu snying rje btung bya ste //
analyzed: rtag tu snying rje btung bya ste //
translated: One should always drink the beer of compassion,

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyur //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyur //
translated: for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: rnal 'byor btung dga'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor btung dga'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who drinks the drink of yoga

original: btung ba gzhan gyis bzhi mi byed //
analyzed: btung ba gzhan gyis bzhi mi byed //
translated: does not drink the four other drinks.

original: ces bya ba la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Here, “always” means at all times.

original: snying rje zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pas so //
translated: “ Compassion” means the desire to remove the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: btung bya ste zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skur gyur pas 'jig rten thams cad la chos bstan pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'grong khyed du 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: btung bya ste zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skur gyur pas 'jig rten thams cad la chos bstan pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'grong khyed du 'dzud pa'o //
translated: “ Drink” means that, having become the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies, he causes all worlds to enter the city of the nirvāṇa that is not a place by teaching the Dharma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyur //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyur //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: he is the cause of the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'di @9b nyid kyang dam pa dag gis 'dod cing don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir btung ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'di @9b nyid kyang dam pa dag gis 'dod cing don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir btung ba'o //
translated: This very wisdom of the nondual union of means and wisdom is the drink, because the holy ones desire and seek it.

original: de 'thung ba la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor ba des ni chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur te blang bar bya ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de 'thung ba la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor ba des ni chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur te blang bar bya ba'i phyogs so //
translated: The yogi who delights in drinking that will attain the dharmakāya. This is the side of what is to be adopted.

original: phyogs cig shos bstan pa /
analyzed: phyogs cig shos bstan pa /
translated: The other side is taught:

original: btung ba gzhan gyis bzhi mi byed //
analyzed: btung ba gzhan gyis bzhi mi byed //
translated: One should not drink anything else.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdud rtsi'i btung ba las gzhan pa thams cad kyis bzhi bar mi byed pa ste chos kyi sku thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdud rtsi'i btung ba las gzhan pa thams cad kyis bzhi bar mi byed pa ste chos kyi sku thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one delights in the practice of the form endowed with the major and minor marks, one will not practice diligence.🔽However, one will delight in the practice of the realization of the qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers, which are spontaneously accomplished.

original: 'di ltar gsungs pa /🔽mtshan dang dpe byad kyi sku gzugs kyi sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bar gyur na 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin no //🔽'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i chos kyis mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs pa / mtshan dang dpe byad kyi sku gzugs kyi sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bar gyur na 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin no // 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i chos kyis mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: It is also said:

original: yang na / rtag tu snying rjes btung bya ste //
analyzed: yang na / rtag tu snying rjes btung bya ste //
translated: One should always drink with compassion.

original: zhes bya ba dus thams cad du snying rje chen po sngon du song bas chang la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsi'i chur byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dus thams cad du snying rje chen po sngon du song bas chang la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsi'i chur byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Thus, at all times, having first generated great compassion, one should consecrate the beer, etc., as the water of nectar.

original: bdag nyid lha'i ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pas btung bar bya ste longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid lha'i ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pas btung bar bya ste longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the pride of being the deity, one should drink it, that is, enjoy it.

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyud //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi rgyud //
translated: The continuum of the cause of the welfare of all sentient beings

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: is the yoga of the hero.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i lus dang ngag ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sems can rnams theg pa'i mchog la 'jug par bya ba'i tshe de kho nar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i lus dang ngag ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sems can rnams theg pa'i mchog la 'jug par bya ba'i tshe de kho nar spyad par bya'o //
translated: As many as are the body and speech yogas of the yogin, all of them should be practiced in reality when the time comes to introduce sentient beings to the supreme vehicle.

original: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Yoga is the samadhi of means and wisdom.

original: de btung ba la dga' ba ni rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de btung ba la dga' ba ni rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The delight in drinking it is the constant and uninterrupted mental attention to it.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul ma lus par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul ma lus par shes pa'o //
translated: The yogin is one who knows all the methods of the commitments and samadhis.

original: btung min gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams mngon par ma dad pa rnams byed pa bsrung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig nyams par byed pa thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul las ring du song ba'o //
analyzed: btung min gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams mngon par ma dad pa rnams byed pa bsrung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig nyams par byed pa thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul las ring du song ba'o //
translated: “Not to drink” means to avoid the transgression of the commitments of protecting the activities of those who are not devoted to the teachings, and so forth, which is to go far beyond the way of method and wisdom.

original: bzi bar byed ces pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba sngon du song bas lus dang ngag dang yid bzhi bar byed pa ste brgyal ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzi bar byed ces pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba sngon du song bas lus dang ngag dang yid bzhi bar byed pa ste brgyal ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “To intoxicate” means to make the body, speech, and mind inebriated by the prior distraction, which is like fainting.

original: gang gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: ngar 'dzin pa ni bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ni bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it produces the conception of “I,”

original: ji ltar ye shes mi brgyal bar //
analyzed: ji ltar ye shes mi brgyal bar //
translated: how can there be non-inebriation

original: dam pa dga' ba'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: dam pa dga' ba'i sems kyis ni //
translated: with the mind that delights in the sublime?

original: chung du nyid la goms par bya //
analyzed: chung du nyid la goms par bya //
translated: One should be habituated to the lesser.

original: zhes so // le'u drug pa rdo rje'i tshig btu ba'o /
analyzed: zhes so // le'u drug pa rdo rje'i tshig btu ba'o /
translated: This concludes the selection from the sixth chapter.

analyzed: // / da ni le'u bcu pa'i rdo rje'i tshig btu ba la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Now, we will begin the selection from the tenth chapter.

translated: is the supporting mandala endowed with the qualities of a square, etc.🔽It is not there,

analyzed: de med ces bya bar sbyar ro //

original: sgom pa po yang med pa ste //
analyzed: sgom pa po yang med pa ste //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang la lha dgu la sogs par bkod pa'i lha rnams te brten pa'i dkyil 'khor de med pa'o //

original: lus med gzung med 'dzin pa'ang med //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: lus med gzung med 'dzin pa'ang med // ces pa ni /
translated: There is no body, no object, no subject.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dkar mo la sogs pa drug dang / mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gti mug rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug med ces pa'o //

translated: The five, Vajrī etc., whose nature is the aggregate of form etc., the six, Pāṇḍarā etc., whose nature is form etc., and the six, Moha-vajriṇī etc., whose nature is the eye etc., are not there.

original: sha med khrag med bshang gci med //

translated: And because it has the nature of natural purity, that mind itself is like the sky at midday in autumn, and so it is said to be like the sky.
